body:
Also please feel free to make the code change (hopefully the WORKSPACE file only?) if you would like to.

Thanks in advance!

Confluent zookeeper([https://github.com/confluentinc/cp-helm-charts/tree/master/charts/cp-zookeeper](https://github.com/confluentinc/cp-helm-charts/tree/master/charts/cp-zookeeper)) is using zookeeper-3.4.14 in their 5.3.0 release, which i believe is the earliest version without the issue. Has any version of heron been tested with at least this version of zookeeper?

Currently ZK release is release-3.5.5, and 3.4.14 was relelased on Apr 1 and it isn't too old. 

I think it makes sense to upgrade to this version.

You should be able to point your configs to an external zookeeper instance and just ignore the embedded zookeeper running the 0.17.8 containers.  This page should help -> https://apache.github.io/incubator-heron/docs/operators/deployment/statemanagers/zookeeper/
Created a PR: https://github.com/apache/incubator-heron/pull/3339. Please let me know if there is any concern.

Code merged into master~

Thanks again for the information! @the-scott-hand
Also thank you very much for being responsive to this ticket and making the update so quickly!!

> @joshfischer1108 the helm chart as it sits in the repo forces the use of the same image for heron tools as it does for zookeeper:
> 
> https://github.com/apache/incubator-heron/blob/dd6da67da7972791639746dd9190fd919ba6986c/deploy/kubernetes/helm/templates/zookeeper.yaml#L83
> 
> I can work around that, but I did want to bring that to your attention as another potential issue.
> 
> What is the latest version of zookeeper that has been tested with heron? I‚Äôm concerned about using an untested zookeeper heron combo in my environment. Am I being overly cautious? What tests have you guys run(if any) to verify this version of zookeeper doesn‚Äôt break anything?

Sure thing. This is an easy/quick change at least.

It is definitely not overly cautious. :)  I have the same concern when making the change. Integration tests don't rely on zk so it is not covered.

For us the zookeeper cluster is maintained by a different team and there could be internal changes, so I have no idea which version it is. :D  But I feel it is a reasonable expectation for them to be compatible.  This zk release has been a few month till now and it has been used by other project. So I am feeling relatively comfortable. Anyways, more testing is definitely a good idea.
@ChethanUK any updates on this PR?
It seems like @ChethanUK has been pretty busy recently. @joshfischer1108 maybe let's merge and then clean it up?
@nwangtw Sounds good to me.
My understanding is to change the log level of instance logs in run time. Let set the log level of an instance from INFO to DEBUG to investigate an issue.

thanks again for the help, would you mind updating this ticket when further testing has been done? I'm looking for something to point to in order to make the case that we should update our environment to use this version other than "works for my stuff"
Will do.
@nwangtw any updates?
Let's merge and then iterate~
The new version seems to be working fine with our test topology.
Discussed offline. Keeping the functions with @Deprecated annotation to be safe.

Thanks a lot!

Licenses are tricky. We are not sure about all the works, but this is one step forward!
Looks good so far.

Some unit test libraries are not Jdk11 compatible and need to be updated. :(
It might be better to move this branch from your forked repo into the main heron repo.  This way people can help us complete this task by opening up PR's directly to this branch.

> It might be better to move this branch from your forked repo into the main heron repo. This way people can help us complete this task by opening up PR's directly to this branch.

Ah, interesting. That is a great idea~

To https://github.com/twitter/heron.git

For issue: #3348
The information is available in Heron UI already in the bottom table. Closing this ticket now.

> keeping logical plan and packing plan visible is helpful for users to be aware of topology structure while they are navigating among tabs

You mean making the plan diagrams sticky? Yeah, I think that could be helpful. Let me think about it. Will be in a new PR. Thanks for the feedback.

https://github.com/apache/incubator-heron/blob/master/heron/executor/src/python/heron_executor.py#L436-L449

https://github.com/apache/incubator-heron/blob/master/heron/executor/src/python/heron_executor.py#L476-L490

From 1.9 and above, it should change as follows.

```
-Xlog:gc=info:file=${APP}/logs/gc.log.$(/bin/date +%Y-%m-%d-%H%M%S):time,uptime,pid:filecount=5,filesize=4096
```

- https://medium.com/hotels-com-technology/what-to-do-about-the-garbage-collector-when-moving-from-java-8-to-java-11-71e60f9b81f
- https://dzone.com/articles/disruptive-changes-to-gc-logging-in-java-9

This could be a useful feature.

stmgr is C++ code. We may need a memory management library that can return the total used ram.

Could something like this be useful?
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/63166/how-to-determine-cpu-and-memory-consumption-from-inside-a-process

@nicknezis If you have some time it would be great if you could help update the docs.  All of the website files are now located in the `website2` directory.  There is a README that should help with building and serving the site locally for development.
@nicknezis any chance you could open up a PR to address these issues?
Thanks for the note @ShawnZhong.  We will hopefully get it addressed soon!

Note that the helm configuration file at https://storage.googleapis.com/heron-charts needs to be updated as well. Otherwise, users following the [helm guide](https://apache.github.io/incubator-heron/docs/operators/deployment/schedulers/kubernetes-helm/) will not be able to get any stats from heron UI. 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6421097/69638320-137a4700-1020-11ea-90eb-f3354f8dd743.png)

I believe the file has already been updated in this repository (see below), but the file at https://storage.googleapis.com/heron-charts was not changed for a while (The last modified time is 2018-04-18). 

https://github.com/apache/incubator-heron/blob/d8db1c50b499c823e319fd16a4476a02f525a367/deploy/kubernetes/helm/templates/tools.yaml#L109-L115
I'm going to let this sit for a day and see if anyone else has any feedback.

Jquery license is fixed in this PR: https://github.com/apache/incubator-heron/pull/3407
Double-checked the libraries in the LICENSE file and added missing files.

JSXTransformer is still TODO. We need to look into it. Currently, it is listed under three licenses: Apache, MIT and BSD, because it contains many modules.
I've started the work. Also updating code to solve #3259

If Zookeeper 5.3.0 is the earliest version without the critical bug, then the Docker distribution build scripts should be updated from 3.4.10. The accepted merge request only updated the client library. 
Somewhat relates to this issue. #3408

This merge also requires the following change:
https://github.com/apache/incubator-heron/pull/3410

it might also be worth noting the yaml in general is doing this correctly, and also utilizing the following annotation:
https://github.com/apache/incubator-heron/blob/d8db1c50b499c823e319fd16a4476a02f525a367/deploy/kubernetes/general/bookkeeper.statefulset.yaml#L126-L127
which is the same annotation being utilized by pulsar's bookie:
https://github.com/apache/pulsar/blob/master/deployment/kubernetes/helm/pulsar/values.yaml#L97
added an additional commit to add that annotation

@nicknezis for this particular issue I believe the earliest without the bug was zookeeper 3.4.14(which was the version used by confluent in their 5.3.0 release), but i agree I don‚Äôt see any reason why the Dockerfiles should still be pointing to 3.4.10
You are right. I updated only the zk client version since it is the code linked to the binary. It is better for all components to be consistent. Let me see what we need to do.

I am not familiar with this part but the change looks reasonable. Thanks.

Please feel free to merge.
https://github.com/apache/incubator-heron/pull/3411
There are a few syntax errors to fix

> There are a few syntax errors to fix

It seems some syntax error only reported undert python2's syntax checker.

```# nlu @ tw-mbp-nlu in ~/workspace/heron on git:neng/py3-migration o [9:39:33]
$ find . -name "*.py" | xargs python -m py_compile
  File "./heron/tools/ui/src/python/main.py", line 190
    print('\n', end='')
                   ^
SyntaxError: invalid syntax

  File "./heron/tools/tracker/src/python/main.py", line 274
    print('\n', end='')
                   ^
SyntaxError: invalid syntax

  File "./heron/tools/cli/src/python/result.py", line 81
    print(msg, file=f)
                   ^
SyntaxError: invalid syntax

  File "./heron/statemgrs/src/python/statemanager.py", line 36
    class StateManager(metaclass=abc.ABCMeta):
                                ^
SyntaxError: invalid syntax
```

But with python3's syntax checker, those errors are gone.
```
# nlu @ tw-mbp-nlu in ~/workspace/heron on git:neng/py3-migration o [9:39:37] C:1
$ find . -name "*.py" | xargs python3 -m py_compile

# nlu @ tw-mbp-nlu in ~/workspace/heron on git:neng/py3-migration o [9:40:21]
$
```
I bumped the API up from 1.0.0-beta3 to 3.0.0. I'm currently working on and testing a fix to use the latest 6.0.1. But this has more API changes so will take slightly longer.

I'm also working on a bigger refresh using the latest version which is currently 6.0.1. There were more API changes so that's a bigger change. I'll submit it as a separate merge request in the future. That one I will need to do more testing on.
@nicknezis  is this ready for review now?
Seems like cpplint is not compatible? Maybe try to upgrade it https://github.com/apache/incubator-heron/tree/master/third_party/python/cpplint

> Seems like cpplint is not compatible? Maybe try to upgrade it https://github.com/apache/incubator-heron/tree/master/third_party/python/cpplint

The original `cpplint.py` file is actually compatible with both 2 and 3 with a built-in rename hack. So most of the changes to it should be reverted.
I'm working on this. Have changes needed for the 6.0.1 version of the Java API. Have not yet made changes to use the in cluster config, but I'll make that change also.

@joshfischer1108 Yes I think it's ready for review.

The 6.0.1 version of my code will be separate pull request because there might be bigger discussion about the code changes. There is value in taking this pull request in the interim because anyone wanting to use K8s 1.16 will have issues with the yamls.
Looks good to me, but is there any value in keeping the Zookeeper version as a Docker build ARG? This change would lose that feature. Probably not a big deal.

> Looks good to me, but is there any value in keeping the Zookeeper version as a Docker build ARG? This change would lose that feature. Probably not a big deal.

How it was used? It should be easy to add back.
